result.execSummary:
The defendant Stanley E Wilder was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. On one or more other charges, Stanley E Wilder was found not guilty. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Stanley E Wilder is presumed innocent of the not guilty charges.

  • Stanley E Wilder was found guilty of Battery or Threat to Judge, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.203(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Plus Supervision Fees.  If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due and all available enforcement actions may be used to collect the debt.  You must  keep the Clerk of Circuit Court informed of your current address until the debt is paid in full.
DE ineligible for voting until civil rights are restored.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Stanley E Wilder in court with attorney Bryce Alan Schoenborn.  Defendant Stanley E Wilder in custody.  James Jay Rennicke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Mr Wilder fires his attorney.  Judge explains to DE he doesnt just get to fire counsel.  Mr Wilder expresses his feelings to the court about many areas.  Mr Wilder expresses to the court he will represent himself.  Court attempts to instruct, Mr Wilder is not receptive to this questioning.  Mr Wilder informs the court that he has a pro bono attorney and does not need to be disclose the name to the court as its his constitutional right.  Court proceeds on instructs to DE without counsel.  Court will not allow DE to represent himself, will continue with Atty Schoenborn.  Mr Wilder adamently objects to this, DE directed back to the sitting position by court security.  DE objects to the verdict delivered by JT, did not comply with PSI preparation.  State begins argument to the court.  State believes DE has 181 days credit.  Atty Schoenborn enters argument.  Stanley Wilder addresses the court as to sentencing.  Court addresses DE as to sentencing.  Mr Wilder objects, and would like to be heard, denied by the court.  Court will order 5 years consisting of  2 years initial confinement, 3 years extended supervision.  DE will have 181 days credit.  DE not eligible for CIP, SAP programs, no voting, no contact with Steven P Anderson, Jeffery Wallace, Richard Summerfield or their families, comply with all programming recommended by DOC agent, no possession of dangerous weapons, DE to provide a DNA sample and pay the surcharge.  Dodge will be the reception facility.
Of confidentiality of Presentence Investigations
Dated 8/02/16 from Judge Babler to Atty Schoenborn
Dated 8/02/16 from Lori Gorsegner to Judge Babler concerning court appointed attorney fees repayment
Letter written by Stanley Wilder.  (mailed to Judge Babler and Atty Schoenborn)
From Jury Trial June 16, 2016 before Honorable John M Yackel, prepared by court reporter Candace K Biskup
Petition for Payment and Order - filed with COC and forwarded to JA for payment on 7/25/16
Sentencing hearing on September 14, 2016 at 08:00 am.
Sentencing hearing on September 14, 2016 at 09:00 am.
Dated 7/07/16 from Atty Bryce Schoenborn to Judge Yackel
With Exhibits number one and two, both entered by the State, received by the court
Jury Seating chart, Juror Sign in Sheet, Jury Peremptory Challenge list.

Defendant Stanley E Wilder in court.  James Jay Rennicke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  9:00AM case called.  Oath given to all jurors.  Twenty jurors called for voir dire.  Juror #919 does not appear.  Court begins introductions, begins questionning.  Court excuses juror #240, 267. 10:03 Jury is selected.  Oath given to jurors.  Instructions given to jurors.  10:07AM juror excused.  Court will resume at 10:25AM.  Court addresses the States issue of a transcript they would like to make reference to during the JT.  If the evidence comes in parties believe it would need to be paraphrased.  Jurors return at 10:27AM.  State begins opening statements to the jury.  Atty Schoenborn addresses the jury.  State will call Lori Gorsegner, oath given.  Direct by the State.  State enters exhibit number one and two-both received by the court.  Copies of exhibits given to jurors.  Cross by Atty Schoenborn.  Witness dismissed.  State calls Judge Anderson.  Oath given. Direct by the State.  Cross by Defense.  Discussion held in chambers.  Witness dismissed.  State calls  Lt Kevin Julien, oath given.  Direct by the State.  Cross by defense.  Redirect by the State.  Witness dismissed.  State calls Irene Lehman, oath given.  Direct by the State.  Cross by Defense.  Witness dismissed.  State calls Ted East, Oath given.  Direct by the State.  Cross by Defense. Discussion in chambers between parties.  Witness dismissed.  State rests.  Jurors excused for lunch @ 11:50AM.  Atty Schoenborn would like to make a motion to dismiss.  State responds, asks motion to be denied.  The court will deny motion.  Court addresses DE as to his right to testify.  DE does intend to testify.  Court adjourned until 12:55PM.  12:56PM court resumes.  Parties are reviewing jury instructions.  Attorney Schoenborn would like to reopen motion to supplement.  State believes this to be a frivolous argument.  Court will deny motion. 1:15PM Jury returns to box.  Atty Schoenborn would like to call his client.  Stanley Wilder called, oath given.  Direct by Atty Schoenborn.  Objection by the State.  Objection, overruled-DE will answer.  Cross by the State.  DE raises objections. Court will excuse jurors to jury room.  Discussions held out of the presence of the jurors.  Atty Schoenborn states his client has a list of questions his client wished him to ask of him, Atty did not ask these questions and DE is upset.  Judge addresses the DE, giving guidelines of what will be accepted.  Discussion held in chambers with counsel/Judge.  DE states he will answer questions of cross examination.  Jurors return to box at 1:51PM.  Cross by the State.  Counsel would like discussions outside the presence of the jury.  2:00PM counsel returns to courtroom.  Cross by the State.  Witness dismissed.  Jurors excused to jury room @ 2:09 PM.  Atty Schoenborn would like to make a motion for direct verdict.  Court will deny motion.  Adjourn till 2:30PM.  Court reviews Jury Instructions with parties.  Atty S would like to be heard on a prior motion, state responds.  Jurors return @ 2:35 PM.  Court begins jury instructions.  State begins closing arguments.  Closing arguments by Atty Schoenborn.  Mr Wilder interrupts his Attorney, stating he would like to give his own closing arguments.  Mr Wilder presents two letters to the courtroom security officer.  Letters are presented to the Judge.  Discussion held in chambers between counsel/Judge.  The Judge wishes the DE removed from the courtrom, will view closing arguments from the jail with video conference.  DE taken into custody.  
Jurors return to the box at 3:30PM.  Judge addressess the jurors as to what has transpired.  Atty Schoenborn makes his closing arguments.  DA Rennicke enters final argument.  Final Instructions given to jurors.  Oath given to Bailiff.  Jurors retired to jury room at 3:41PM.  Back on the record outside the presence of the jury,  the Judge addresses the previous proceedings of the DE.  4:20PM, the jury has reached a verdict.  Jurors return at 4:20PM.  Ct 1-guilty,  Ct 2-NG.  State requests polling of jurors.   Jurors polled as to Ct 1-all yes.   Court gives closing instructions to jurors.  Jurors excused at 4:30PM.  4:32PM Mr Wilder is brought back up to the courtroom.  The court will order a PSI be prepared.  State asks for bond to be revoked.  Atty Schoenborn objects.  Court will revoke bond. Judge Yackel will recuse himself from this case.  Judge Yackel offers Mr Wilder the right to speak.  Court will hold DE in contempt and fine him $100.00.

Defendant Stanley E Wilder in court with attorney Bryce Alan Schoenborn.  James Jay Rennicke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State is opposing prior convictions #3 and #8 of motions filed.  Parties make argument on all points objected to.  Jury will be called in at 7:45AM, JT Vior Dire will begin at 8:15AM.  Motions will be heard if any at 8:00AM.

Motion hearing on June 3, 2016 at 01:00 pm.
Jury trial - 12 person on June 16, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Stanley E Wilder in court with attorney Bryce Alan Schoenborn.  Defendant Stanley E Wilder in custody.  James Jay Rennicke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The court will make the finding that Mr Wilder is now competent to assist in his defense.  Atty is requesting that DE be released under the conditions of his current bond.  Court addresses Mr Wilder as to continuing with medications.  Mr Wilder states he understands.  Mr Wilder has addressed the court as to new counsel, court questions DE as to this request.  DE states he does not want to answer the question as to new counsel.  The court will not allow DE to proceed without counsel, gives the DE the choice of new appointed counsel or remaining with Atty Schoenborn on this case.  The court will not release Atty Schoenborn at this time.  The State wishes to proceed to JT.  JT 6-16-16 @ 8:30AM, MH set for 6-03-16 @ 1:00PM.  DE will be released today.
Dated 5/06/16 from LG to parties
and Order, unsigned.
5 certified copies to DA office on this date
Competency hearing on May 11, 2016 at 02:00 pm.
Copy of report mailed to Atty Schoenborn and given to DA.

Attorney Bryce Alan Schoenborn in court.  James Jay Rennicke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Hearing held by VC from Sawyer County.  Heard along with 15CM112, 15CM113.  Motion for DE's request to obtain alternate evalution and stop current medications.  The issue of who would be responsible for paying for the evaluation is addressed by the parties.  The court will deny the motion for another appointment of examiner and deny the suspension of medications.  Nothing further scheduled at this time.  Court adjourned @4:00PM.
Motion hearing on April 26, 2016 at 03:30 pm.
Defendant's motion for independent psychological competency evaluation and stay of administration of medications, filed by Atty Bryce Schoenborn
Completed by Dr Hammer
Fax confirmation sheet for amended report  (faxed to Mendota)
Amended competency evaluation report  (filed in 15CF118)
(one copy faxed to Mendota, copy to Sd, copy to Parties)

Defendant Stanley E Wilder in court with attorney Bryce Alan Schoenborn.  James Jay Rennicke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court addresses Mr Wilder as to necessary conversations that will be conducted with the District Attorney.  State calls the case.   Atty Schoenborn has not seen a copy of the report, State provides a copy to Atty/DE.  Court will adjourn to allow parties time to review the report.  10:15 AM, back on the record.  Mr Wilder disagrees with the report, believes he is competent.  Court contacts Dr Minter, via telephone.  Oath given.  Direct by the State.  Cross by Atty Schoenborn.  Objection, sustained.  Redirect by the State.  The court asks Dr Minter to send an amended report, parties will be provided a copy.  The State asks that the report of Dr Minter be accepted by the court, court will accept.  Argument entered by the State.  Argument entered by Atty Schoenborn.  The State asks the court to grant the State's motion.  The court will find that Mr Wilder is incompetent, also finds DE is not competent to refuse medications.  The court will order Mr Wilder be placed in protective custody for treatment.  Reports will be provided to the courts after 3 months, 6-9 months.  Court will order DE to Wisconsin Mental Health Institute for treatment.  DE will be taken into custody today.  Atty Schoenborn addresses the court as to withdrawing as counsel, DE has expressed several concerns of Atty's integrity and ability.  The court wishes Atty Schoenborn to stay on the case until the first report has been submitted by the Mental Institute.  Mr Wilder addresses the court.  Court is adjourned.
Filed in 15CF118. Copies of report provided to parties.
Transcript from Hearing Friday, January 15, 2016 before Honorable John M Yackel, prepared by court reporter Connie G Dillon.
Dated 1/27/16 from Donna Minter, PhD to Stanley Wilder  (filed in 15CF118)
Competency hearing at 02-22-2016 09:15 am

Defendant Stanley E Wilder in court with attorney Bryce Alan Schoenborn.  James Jay Rennicke appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Heard along with 15CM112, 15CM113.  Hearing for competency evaluation.  DE has not made himself available for the examination.  State makes a request to the court as to completing the evaluation.  Atty Schoenborn requests hearing be set out to allow time for his client to complete the evaluation.  DE relies on US mail and things are not timely to him.  The court has concerns about the cooperation of DE with Dr Minter and completing the evaluation.  The court will allow one more adjournment for completing eval.  If DE does not complete the eval the court will revoke bond and DE held in custody until completion.  The court will schedule a Competency hearing for 2-22-16 @ 9:15AM.  Competency hearing scheduled for February 22, 2016 at 09:15 am.
Dated 1-11-16 from Donna Minter to Judge Yackel.

Competency hearing at 01-15-2016 09:00 am

Defendant Stanley E Wilder in court with stand by attorney Bryce Schoenborn.  James Jay Rennicke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court recites prior court events into the court record.  DE states he has counsel.  DE states he is appearing today as a prosee attorney.  The court appoints Atty Bryce Schoenborn as counsel.  DE objects, noted by the court.  The State raises the issue of competency and requests a competency evaluation.  The court will suspend this hearing for the time being.  Court will order a competency evaluation be performed on DE.  Order will order eval in all three cases.  Set for competency hearing 1-15-16 @ 9:00AM.
Status conference at 12-04-2015 09:00 am

Defendant Stanley E Wilder in court with Stand by counsel Bryce Schoenborn.  James Jay Rennicke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Heard along with 15CM112, 15CM113.  Judge Yackel informs DE of what is expected of his demeanor in his court, DE understands.  State first motion is for joinder of all cases for Jury Trial, State summarizes motion to the court.  DE makes his position to the court.  The court has concerns if DE is competent to defend himself for trial.  Court addresses the State and Atty Schoenborn.   DE has objections and wishes the right to hire private counsel.  JT will come off on 12-04-15.  The court will use this time as a status conf.  DE has until 12-04-15 to hire private counsel, if he comes to this hearing unrepresented the court will appoint Atty Schoenborn.  Motions will also be addressed at this time. DE raises strong objections to the courts directions.   12-04-15 @ 9:00AM, status conference.

Defendant Stanley E Wilder in court with attorney Bryce Schoenborn as stand by counsel.  James Jay Rennicke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Judge encourages Mr Wiler to seek counsel provided for his case.  DE will consider this for the court.   Set for RH 11-20-15 @ 2:30PM.

Exhibit number one-letter written by Stanley Wilder, entered by the State

Defendant Stanley E Wilder in court with attorney Bryce Schoenborn.  James Jay Rennicke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Heard along with 15CF112, 15CM113.  Court addresses the document filed by Mr Wilder.  Mr Wilder addresses the court as to his request to tape record the court proceedings from today.  The court informs Mr Wilder that he will provide him with the correct Address and phone number to the Hayward courthouse after today's proceedings.  Mr Wilder addresses the court as the the motion he has filed to dismiss charges.  State responds.  Court will deny motions to dismiss in all cases.  
PH-State call Chief Allen Lobermier, oath given.  Court addresses DE as to his desire to represent himself or have standby counsel represent him.  DE still wishes to represent himself at this time.  Direct by the State.   State enters exhibit one, received by the Court.  Cross by Mr Wilder.  Objection by the State, sustained.  Objection, sustained.  Objection, sustained.  Off the record-back on the record.  Cross continues by Stanley Wilder.  Objection, sustained.  DE asks the Court to dismiss witness and proceed with the case.  Redirect by the State.  Witness dismissed.  State rests and asks for bind over.  Closing statement by DE.  The court will find probable cause exits, will bind over for JT, will proceed to arraignment.  Information filed by the State.  DE will enter a plea of NG to Ct 1.  DE will enter pleas of NG to all other counts in CM cases.  Set for JT 12-04-15 @ 8:00AM for motions, JT to begin at 8:30.  Set for final PTC 10-29-15 @ 1:30 PM.  Could possibly be done by VC for Judge.  Deadline for filing motions will be 10-29-15.  DE would like bond clarified.  DE states he has borrowed the bond money and now may possibly need to turn himself in so the bond money can be returned to poster.  Court will modify bond by removing the five mile radius of victims and residence.  The no contacts with victims, there families and residences will remain.  15FO135-DE will enter a plea of NG.  Set for court trial 9-25-15.
Preliminary hearing at 08-28-2015 09:00 am
Motion hearing at 08-28-2015 09:00 am

Defendant Stanley E Wilder in court with attorney Bryce Schoenborn.  James Jay Rennicke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court in session 8:39 a.m. - Heard along with 15CM112 and 15CM113 - DA Rennicke states appearances - Attorney Schoenborn is stand by counsel for defendant - Initial Appearances scheduled for today on all cases.  Court addresses defendant - he has read the complaints.  Court addresses the defendant. Defendant states he is representing himself pro se.  Court addresses Attorney Schoenborn - he will proceed as stand by attorney only and Attorney Schoenborn agrees.  Defendant has filed a Motion - the Judge has received it - Court states he will be here Friday 8/28/15 at 9:00 a.m. for the MH as well as the PH here in Rusk County.  Court will enter NG pleas on the CM cases.  Attorney Schoenborn is available for Fridays hearing as standby counsel.  Court advises def if he wants full counsel he is to contact he PD office to have one appointed.  DA requests current bonds to continue in present form - so ordered by the Court.  PH to be held first then MH.  Mr. Wilder addresses the Court.  Trespass citation for tomorrow.  This citation is not part of these criminal proceedings.  Court adjourned 8:47 a.m.
Dated 8/24/15 written by Lori Gorsegner to Chief Deputy Phil Grassman  (filed in 15CM112)
Initial appearance at 08-24-2015 08:30 am

ANDERSON OR TO COME WITHIN 5 MILES OF JUDGE ANDERSON'S RESIDENCE, NO CONTACT WITH ATTORNEY RICHARD SUMMERFIELD OR TO COME WITHIN 5 MILES OF RICHARD SUMMERFIELD'S RESIDENCE AND NO CONTACT WITH SHERIFF JEFF WALLACE OR TO COME WITHIN 5 MILES OF SHERIFF JEFF WALLACE'S RESIDENCE.

Defendant Stanley E Wilder in court, in custody.  James Jay Rennicke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Hearing held along with 15CM112, 15CM113 - Wilder received copies of the complaint.  Def Waives the reading of the complaints.  Initial Appearances.  Mr. Wilder will be representing himself.  Court takes judicial notice of the official record during the CV TRO cases recently held and statements made.  Court questions Mr. Wilder.  Court finds Mr. Wilder will be appointed a standby lawyer to represent him.  That Lawyer will call him at the jail to assist him.  Mr. Wilder makes request to the Court on title of nobility.   N2677 Wilder Road, Bruce, WI  54819 - Rennicke requests $10,000 Cash bond - if posted not to come within 5 miles of Judge A's residence, Mr. Summerfields residence or Jeff Wallaces residence.  Mr. Wilder makes statement.  Court questions Mr. Wilder as to if he wants a different Judge in these proceeds.  Yes he does - Clerk to get new Judgew - Court adjourend 10:14 a.m.
